snippet: A new class-action lawsuit says that New York City has a policy and a history of violating protesters’ constitutional rights.
abstract: Occupy Wall Street protesters file false-arrest lawsuit against New York City, claiming that police officers violated their free speech rights during first anniversary of 2011 protests; lawsuit seeks damages and court order that would stop police officers from charging people engaged in First Amendment speech with disorderly conduct absent criminal behavior.
lead_paragraph: A new class-action lawsuit says that New York City has a policy and a history of violating protesters’ constitutional rights.

headline.main: Suit Says Police Violated Occupy Wall Street Protesters’ Constitutional Rights
headline.print_headline: Lawsuit Says Police Violated Occupy Protesters’ Rights
